name: Vietnamese Lemongrass Grilled Beef Spring Rolls (Thịt Bò Nướng Cuốn Bánh Tráng)
description: A rice paper roll that consists of thinly sliced beef, quickly seared in onions and butter, and plenty of fresh vegetables and Vietnamese herbs. Served with a pungent fermented anchovy sauce or a more tamed Vietnamese fish sauce dipping sauce.
keywords: goi cuon, gỏi cuốn, goi cuon thit bo, beef, grilling, beef spring rolls, spring rolls, how to make spring rolls, fresh spring rolls, beef spring rolls, fermented fish sauce, fermented anchovy sauce, mam nem, nuoc cham, fresh beef spring rolls with fermented fish sauce, fresh beef spring rolls with dipping sauce, fresh spring roll recipe, how to make spring rolls, how to make vietnamese fresh spring rolls, how to wrap spring rolls, lemongrass beef, vietnamese lemongrass beef, Bò Nướng Vĩ, bo nuong vi

video.name: Vietnamese Lemongrass Grilled Beef - Bò Nướng Vĩ
video.description: Vietnamese Lemongrass Grilled Beef - Bò Nướng Vĩ

recipeIngredient: 2 lbs beef (beef chuck, tenderloin, ribeye, sirloin, or center round)
1 yellow onion (peel and cut into thin wedges)
Vietnamese Fermented Anchovy Dipping Sauce (Mắm Nêm) (my favorite)
Vietnamese Fish Sauce Dipping Sauce (Nước Mắm Chấm)
recipeInstructions: Thinly slice the beef against the grain into bite-size pieces. Set aside.

In a large mixing bowl, combine lemongrass, garlic, onion, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar, orange juice, sesame oil, and optional red pepper flakes. Add sliced beef and marinate for at least 30 minutes or overnight in the fridge for better results.

It is best to cook the beef outside using a portable butane burner and a grill plate. Heat up the griddle and melt a tablespoon of butter at a time. Add a portion of beef and quickly grill for 2-3 minutes.

Lightly wet a sheet of rice paper in a water bowl. Allow about 5 seconds for it to soften. Add grilled beef and your favorite vegetables in the middle of the wet rice paper. Tuck in the sides and roll up to seal. Dip the spring roll in your choice of dipping sauce. Grill as you go for the best results.
